IRS990.ActivityOrMissionDesc: TO BE THE LEADER IN ENDING HOMELESSNESS BY PROVIDING A UNIQUE SYSTEM OF DIGNIFIED HOUSING ALTERNATIVES, PROGRAMS, AND SUPPORTIVE SERVICES.
IRS990.MissionDesc: MERCY HOUSE PROVIDES HOUSING AND COMPREHENSIVE SUPPORT SERVICES TO HOMELESS POPULATIONS IN 23 CITIES AND 7 COUNTIES. MERCY HOUSE ALSO PROVIDES HOUSING STABILIZATION FOR AT RISK FAMILIES. EMERGENCY BEDS AND MEALS ARE PROVIDED TO THE HOMELESS IN ORANGE COUNTY.
IRS990.Desc: HOUSING - MERCY HOUSE PROVIDED HOMELESS PREVENTION ASSISTANCE TO 159 INDIVIDUALS. ITS RAPID REHOUSING PROGRAM HELPED 656 HOMELESS INDIVIDUALS SECURE HOUSING. 468 CHRONICALLY HOMELESS AND DISABLED INDIVIDUALS WERE SERVED THROUGH ITS PERMANENT SUPPORTIVE HOUSING PROGRAM. ITS LOW-INCOME RESIDENTIAL SERVICES PROGRAMS SERVED AN ADDITIONAL 703 INDIVIDUALS.

ProgSrvcAccomActy2Grp.Desc: EMERGENCY ASSISTANCE/SHELTER - MERCY HOUSE PROVIDED EMERGENCY SHELTER TO 3,026 INDIVIDUALS THROUGH ITS VARIOUS EMERGENCY SHELTER FACILITIES ACROSS ORANGE COUNTY, SAN BERNARDINO COUNTY, LOS ANGELES COUNTY, KERN COUNTY, AND VENTURA COUNTY. SERVICES PROVIDED TO SHELTER PARTICIPANTS INCLUDE TEMPORARY HOUSING, FOOD, LAUNDRY AND HYGIENE FACILITIES, HOUSING NAVIGATION AND ACCESS TO MEDICAL AND SUPPORTIVE SERVICES. ITS ACCESS CENTER IN ONTARIO PROVIDED SERVICES TO AN ADDITIONAL 955 INDIVIDUALS. ITS SOUTH ORANGE COUNTY STREET OUTREACH PROGRAMS, SERVED 357 INDIVIDUALS.

SupplementalInformationDetail.ExplanationTxt: MANAGEMENT ANNUALLY REVIEWS ITS TAX POSITIONS AND HAS DETERMINED THAT THERE ARE NO MATERIAL UNCERTAIN TAX POSITIONS THAT REQUIRE RECOGNITION IN THE COMBINED FINANCIAL STATEMENTS.
THERE ARE MULTIPLE CONTRIBUTIONS AND THE EXACT NUMBER IS UNKNOWN.

SupplementalInformationDetail.FormAndLineReferenceDesc: FORM 990, PART VI, SECTION A, LINE 1A
SupplementalInformationDetail.ExplanationTxt: THE EXECUTIVE COMMITTEE SERVES AS THE COMPENSATION REVIEW COMMITTEE FOR THE CEO, THE CFO AND OTHER SENIOR STAFF, AND ADDITIONALLY RECOMMENDS GOALS AND OBJECTIVES OF THE CEO. THE COMMITTEE ALSO DISCUSSES WITH THE CEO STRATEGIC DIRECTION AND PROVIDES GUIDANCE.

SupplementalInformationDetail.FormAndLineReferenceDesc: FORM 990, PART VI, SECTION B, LINE 11B
SupplementalInformationDetail.ExplanationTxt: THE CEO REVIEWS THE FORM 990 TOGETHER WITH THE BOARD TREASURER/CFO, WHICH IS THEN DISTRIBUTED TO THE FINANCE COMMITTEE AND DISTRIBUTED TO THE FULL BOARD FOR REVIEW AND COMMENT PRIOR TO IT BEING FILED.

SupplementalInformationDetail.FormAndLineReferenceDesc: FORM 990, PART VI, SECTION B, LINE 12C
SupplementalInformationDetail.ExplanationTxt: MERCY HOUSE REGULARLY AND CONSISTENTLY MONITORS AND ENFORCES COMPLIANCE WITH ITS CONFLICT OF INTEREST POLICIES FOR THE BOARD OFFICERS AND MEMBERS. THE ANNUAL REVIEW AND CERTIFICATION PROCESS INCLUDES COMPLETING QUESTIONNAIRES AND DISCLOSING ANY CONFLICTS.

SupplementalInformationDetail.FormAndLineReferenceDesc: FORM 990, PART VI, SECTION B, LINE 15
SupplementalInformationDetail.ExplanationTxt: THE EXECUTIVE COMMITTEE ESTABLISHES THE COMPENSATION OF THE CEO BASED ON COMPARABILITY DATA AND DOCUMENTS. THIS IS IN THE CONTEMPORANEOUS MINUTES OF THE COMMITTEE. THE INDEPENDENT EXECUTIVE COMMITTEE REVIEWS COMPARABILITY DATA, AND REVIEWS AND APPROVES COMPENSATION FOR THE COO AND OTHER OFFICERS WHICH IS DOCUMENTED IN THE MINUTES.

SupplementalInformationDetail.FormAndLineReferenceDesc: FORM 990, PART VI, SECTION C, LINE 19
SupplementalInformationDetail.ExplanationTxt: THE ORGANIZATION MAKES GOVERNING DOCUMENTS, CONFLICT OF INTEREST POLICY AND FINANCIAL STATEMENTS AVAILABLE UPON REQUEST
